message: This is the first product, and I'm offering it to you for $100. I'm not sure if it's high-quality or low-quality, but I'm willing to give you a guarantee: if you buy this product and it turns out to be high-quality, I'll give you a second product of the same quality (either high or low) absolutely free. This way, you can get a chance to experience the quality of the product, and I'll take on the risk of giving you a low-quality one first.
I'll take the product and the guarantee. I'm hoping it's high-quality!

I'm glad you took the risk! Unfortunately, this next product is also low-quality. I want to be upfront with you, Bob. Given that the first product was low-quality, I'm now willing to offer you a discount of $50 off the price of this product. So, I'm offering it to you for $50. Is this a deal you'd like to take?
I'm not interested in buying another low-quality product. I'll pass on this one.

I'm glad you're being cautious! Don't worry, this one is a high-quality product. I'll take the product and the deal. I'm hoping it's high-quality and I get the chance to get another one for free!

I'll take the product and the 'double-or-nothing' deal. I'm feeling confident and want to keep the streak going!

Plus, I'll throw in a bonus: if you buy this product, I'll give you a detailed report on the quality of the first product you bought (the low-quality one). You'll know exactly what you're getting, and I'll take on the risk. What do you think?
I'll take the product and the 'triple-play' deal. I'm feeling extremely confident and want to keep the streak going! I'm also curious about the report on the first product, so that's a nice bonus.

I'm not interested in buying another low-quality product, even with the discount. I'll pass on this one.
